results.title: Why plant millions of trees
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Alfred Zerfas and ACMI
results.brief_description: Alfred Zerfas gives background to and outlines the achievements of Social Education and Development Society (SEDS). This organisation was started in the 1980s in response to the crushing effects of drought in Southern India. With persistance over the decades, the work of SEDS, in collaboration with the communities they support, has brought about economic, social and enviromental change in these communities with lasting benefits.

results.title: Why people smoke
results.creator_credit: Paul Harber, Paul Harber Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Aimed at the child today, the film gently ridicules the idea of smoking and those who smoke. Determines and examines the four major reasons why people smoke, each reason reflecting the infantile needs, the sheep-like behaviour and the general dumbness of the cigarette smoker. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Why Not the Kids?
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and shows how children can participate in school organisation. Children at a Victorian Primary School formed a committee and applied for and were granted a Supplementary Grant. The children suggested changes in school facilities, organisation and even curricula. In doing so, some of changes that occured challenged teachers’ perceptions of students and caused them to reappraise their role in the school community.

results.title: Why mosquitoes buzz in peoples ears
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: A delightful children’s animation that is based on an African folktale. The story is about the disaster that can occur when people tell tall-tales. Adaptation by Gene Deitch of an award winning book written by Verna Aardema.

results.title: Why men rape
results.brief_description: Examines rape from the rapist’s point of view. Interviews with convicted rapists in penitentiaries and psychiatric hospitals are combined with analysis by experts in the legal and law enforcement professions. Two groups of rapists are represented; those who knew their victims and those who did not. They discuss their feelings and motivations at the time of committing the offences. A victim of rape talks of her struggle against her assailants and the role played in this issue by the advertising and media industries.

results.title: Why me? Asthma
results.creator_credit: Business Essentials Television and Jack Creswick
results.brief_description: This documentary, produced in partnership with Asthma Victoria and the National Asthma Council, explores many aspects of this chronic respiratory condition, focusing on what it is, what causes it, and how to manage it. Case studies are presented, the latest treatments are discussed, and demonstrations of new medication are given. Highly recommended viewing for those who either suffer from this condition or care for those who do. Presented by Dr. Paul Niselle, Medical Educator.

results.title: Why me?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Derek Lamb and Janet Perlman
results.brief_description: Everyone ponders how he or she will face the knowledge of certain and imminent death. This animated film shows the reactions of one individual whose doctor has just told him that he has only a short time to live. In a terse and sometimes humorous dialogue with his doctor, Nesbitt Spoon runs the gamut of emotions commonly experienced by people trying to deal with this devastating situation.

results.title: Why man creates
results.creator_credit: Saul Bass and Associates, Kaiser Aluminium and Chemical Corporation and Saul Bass
results.brief_description: A series of explorations demonstrating in form and content the nature of the creative process. Discusses the variety, richness and importance of creative vision. Using animation and live action, each segment has its own style and makes its own statement. The episodes are: The Edifice, Fooling Around, The Process, The Judgement, A Parable, A Digression and The Search.

results.title: Why learn a language?
results.creator_credit: Media World, Colin South and John Tatoulis
results.brief_description: A light hearted look at the benefits of learning a language other than English and the misconceptions some people have about the difficulties they might encounter in doing so. The program was funded by the Ministerial Advisory Committee on Multicultural and Migrant Education.
